FuncDef:
The ds-lite port-limit enable command enables the limitation on the number of user-based DS-Lite ports that can be assigned.
The undo ds-lite port-limit enable command disables the limitation on the number of user-based DS-Lite ports that can be assigned.
The limitation is disabled by default.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To prevent the number of connections to a CPE from exceeding the specified range, run the ds-lite port-limit enable command to limit the number of assignable ports.
Configuration Impact
After the ds-lite port-limit enable command is run in the DS-Lite instance view, the system will assign only a specified number of ports to the CPEs in a DS-Lite instance.
Precautions
The ds-lite port-limit command can be run to limit the number of assignable ports in a DS-Lite address pool working in 3-tuple mode only after the ds-lite port-limit enable command is run to enable the restriction.
This command does not take effect on the address-based DS-Lite internal server.
